trans-unit.source: Schedule Backend Tasks with Scheduler | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Schedule Backend Tasks with Scheduler | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Mobile Services Scheduler to schedule jobs for your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Mobile Services Scheduler to schedule jobs for your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Schedule recurring jobs in Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Schedule recurring jobs in Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use the job scheduler functionality in the Management Portal to define server script code that is executed based on a schedule that you define.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use the job scheduler functionality in the Management Portal to define server script code that is executed based on a schedule that you define.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the script periodically check with a remote service, in this case Twitter, and stores the results in a new table.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the script periodically check with a remote service, in this case Twitter, and stores the results in a new table.

trans-unit.source: Some other periodic tasks that can be scheduled include:
trans-unit.target: Some other periodic tasks that can be scheduled include:

trans-unit.source: Archiving old or duplicate data records.
trans-unit.target: Archiving old or duplicate data records.

trans-unit.source: Requesting and storing external data, such as tweets, RSS entries, and location information.
trans-unit.target: Requesting and storing external data, such as tweets, RSS entries, and location information.

trans-unit.source: Processing or resizing stored images.
trans-unit.target: Processing or resizing stored images.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use the job scheduler to create a scheduled job that requests tweet data from Twitter and stores the tweets in a new Updates table.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use the job scheduler to create a scheduled job that requests tweet data from Twitter and stores the tweets in a new Updates table.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register for access to Twitter v1.1 APIs and store credentials
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register for access to Twitter v1.1 APIs and store credentials

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create the new Updates table
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create the new Updates table

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to create a new table in which to store tweets.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to create a new table in which to store tweets.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab for your mobile service, then click +Create.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click the Data tab for your mobile service, then click +Create.

trans-unit.source: In Table name type Updates, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In Table name type Updates, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a new scheduled job
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a new scheduled job

trans-unit.source: Now, you can create the scheduled job that accesses Twitter and stores tweet data in the new Updates table.
trans-unit.target: Now, you can create the scheduled job that accesses Twitter and stores tweet data in the new Updates table.

trans-unit.source: Click the Scheduler tab, then click +Create.
trans-unit.target: Click the Scheduler tab, then click +Create.

trans-unit.source: When you run your mobile service in <html></html>Free<html></html> tier, you are only able to run one scheduled job at a time.
trans-unit.target: When you run your mobile service in <html></html>Free<html></html> tier, you are only able to run one scheduled job at a time.

trans-unit.source: In paid tiers, you can run up to ten scheduled jobs at a time.
trans-unit.target: In paid tiers, you can run up to ten scheduled jobs at a time.

trans-unit.source: In the scheduler dialog, enter getUpdates for the Job Name, set the schedule interval and units, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In the scheduler dialog, enter getUpdates for the Job Name, set the schedule interval and units, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new job named getUpdates.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new job named getUpdates.

trans-unit.source: Click the new job you just created, click the Script tab and replace the placeholder function getUpdates with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Click the new job you just created, click the Script tab and replace the placeholder function getUpdates with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This script calls the Twitter query API using stored credentials to request recent tweets that contain the hashtag #mobileservices.
trans-unit.target: This script calls the Twitter query API using stored credentials to request recent tweets that contain the hashtag #mobileservices.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate tweets and replies are removed from the results before they are stored in the table.
trans-unit.target: Duplicate tweets and replies are removed from the results before they are stored in the table.

trans-unit.source: This sample assumes that only a few rows are inserted into the table during each scheduled run.
trans-unit.target: This sample assumes that only a few rows are inserted into the table during each scheduled run.

trans-unit.source: In cases where many rows are inserted in a loop you may run out of connections when running on the Free tier.
trans-unit.target: In cases where many rows are inserted in a loop you may run out of connections when running on the Free tier.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you should perform inserts in batches.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you should perform inserts in batches.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Perform bulk inserts</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Perform bulk inserts</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Run Once to test the script.
trans-unit.target: Click Run Once to test the script.

trans-unit.source: This saves and executes the job while it remains disabled in the scheduler.
trans-unit.target: This saves and executes the job while it remains disabled in the scheduler.

trans-unit.source: Click the back button, click Data, click the Updates table, click Browse, and verify that Twitter data has been inserted into the table.
trans-unit.target: Click the back button, click Data, click the Updates table, click Browse, and verify that Twitter data has been inserted into the table.

trans-unit.source: Click the back button, click Scheduler, select getUpdates, then click Enable.
trans-unit.target: Click the back button, click Scheduler, select getUpdates, then click Enable.

trans-unit.source: This enables the job to run on the specified schedule, in this case every hour.
trans-unit.target: This enables the job to run on the specified schedule, in this case every hour.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations, you have successfully created a new scheduled job in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have successfully created a new scheduled job in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This job will be executed as scheduled until you disable or modify it.
trans-unit.target: This job will be executed as scheduled until you disable or modify it.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>See also
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>See also

trans-unit.source: [Mobile Services server script reference]
trans-unit.target: [Mobile Services server script reference]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn more about registering and using server scripts.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn more about registering and using server scripts.
